TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SecureString extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable
Public NotInheritable Class SecureString Implements IDisposable
public ref class SecureString sealed : IDisposable

summary.span: 表示应保密的文本，例如在不再需要时将其从计算机内存中删除。

span.span: Represents text that should be kept confidential, such as by deleting it from computer memory when no longer needed.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!IMPORTANT] > 我们不建议你使用`SecureString`类的新的开发。We don't recommend that you use the `SecureString` class for new development. 有关详细信息，请参阅[不应使用 SecureString](https://github.com/dotnet/platform-compat/blob/master/docs/DE0001.md) GitHub 上。For more information, see [SecureString shouldn't be used](https://github.com/dotnet/platform-compat/blob/master/docs/DE0001.md) on GitHub. 是字符串类型，它提供措施。 is a string type that provides a measure of security. 它将尝试以避免以明文形式的进程内存中存储可能敏感的字符串。It tries to avoid storing potentially sensitive strings in process memory as plain text. (有关限制，但是，请参阅[SecureString 的是否安全？](#HowSecure)部分。)实例的值使用一种机制，该实例已初始化或修改值时由基础平台支持自动保护。(For limitations, however, see the [How secure is SecureString?](#HowSecure) section.) The value of an instance of is automatically protected using a mechanism supported by the underlying platform when the instance is initialized or when the value is modified. 应用程序可以使实例不可变，并通过调用防止进一步修改方法。Your application can render the instance immutable and prevent further modification by invoking the method. 最大长度实例为 65,536 个字符。The maximum length of a instance is 65,536 characters. > [!IMPORTANT] > 此类型实现接口。This type implements the interface. 完成使用类型的实例后，您应释放它直接或间接。When you have finished using an instance of the type, you should dispose of it either directly or indirectly. 若要直接释放类型，调用其中的方法`try` / `catch`块。To dispose of the type directly, call its method in a `try`/`catch` block. 若要间接释放类型，请使用 `using`（在 C# 中）或 `Using`（在 Visual Basic 中）等语言构造。To dispose of it indirectly, use a language construct such as `using` (in C#) or `Using` (in Visual Basic). 有关详细信息，请参阅中的"使用对象实现 IDisposable"一节接口主题。For more information, see the "Using an Object that Implements IDisposable" section in the interface topic. 类和其成员不是对 COM 可见。The class and its members are not visible to COM. 有关详情，请参阅。For more information, see . 本节内容：In this section: [Vs 的字符串。SecureString](#vsString) [String vs. SecureString](#vsString) [SecureString 操作](#Ops) [SecureString operations](#Ops) [SecureString 和互操作](#interop) [SecureString and interop](#interop) [SecureString 是否安全？How secure is SecureString?](#HowSecure) ## 与 SecureString 的字符串String versus SecureString 实例类既不可变，并不再需要时，不能以编程方式计划进行垃圾回收; 也就是说，该实例是只读的创建，并不能预测时将实例后从计算机内存中删除。An instance of the class is both immutable and, when no longer needed, cannot be programmatically scheduled for garbage collection; that is, the instance is read-only after it is created, and it is not possible to predict when the instance will be deleted from computer memory. 因为实例是不可变，看起来要修改现有实例的操作实际创建一份该操作。Because instances are immutable, operations that appear to modify an existing instance actually create a copy of it to manipulate. 因此，如果对象包含敏感信息，如密码、 信用卡号或个人数据，则在使用，因为你的应用程序不能从计算机内存中删除数据后，可能会泄露信息的风险.Consequently, if a object contains sensitive information such as a password, credit card number, or personal data, there is a risk the information could be revealed after it is used because your application cannot delete the data from computer memory. 一个对象都类似于对象，其文本值。A object is similar to a object in that it has a text value. 但是，值对象被固定在内存中，可以使用一种保护机制，如可以修改由基础操作系统提供的加密，直到你的应用程序将其标记为只读的并可以从计算机内存中删除通过应用程序调用方法或.NET Framework 垃圾回收器。However, the value of a object is pinned in memory, may use a protection mechanism, such as encryption, provided by the underlying operating system, can be modified until your application marks it as read-only, and can be deleted from computer memory either by your application calling the method or by the .NET Framework garbage collector. 有关限制的讨论类，请参阅[SecureString 的是否安全？](#HowSecure)部分。For a discussion of the limitations of the class, see the [How secure is SecureString?](#HowSecure) section. [返回页首Back to top](#top) ## SecureString 操作SecureString operations 类包括成员，您可以执行以下操作：The class includes members that allow you to do the following: 实例化对象Instantiate a object 实例化对象通过调用其无参数构造函数。You instantiate a object by calling its parameterless constructor. 添加到字符对象Add characters to a object 可以在一次向添加单个字符对象通过调用其或方法。You can add a single character at a time to a object by calling its or method. > [!IMPORTANT] > 一个对象应永远不会从构造，这是因为敏感数据已受到的不可变的内存持久性后果类。A object should never be constructed from a , because the sensitive data is already subject to the memory persistence consequences of the immutable class. 构造的最好办法对象时一次一字符的非托管源，如方法。The best way to construct a object is from a character-at-a-time unmanaged source, such as the method. 删除从字符对象Remove characters from a object 您可以通过调用来替换单个字符方法，通过调用删除单个字符方法或删除所有从字符实例通过调用方法。You can replace an individual character by calling the method, remove an individual character by calling the method, or remove all characters from the instance by calling the method. 使对象只读的Make the object read-only 定义字符串后，对象表示，则调用其方法可使字符串只读的。Once you have defined the string that the object represents, you call its method to make the string read-only. 获取其相关信息对象Get information about the object 类具有提供的字符串信息的只有两个成员： 其属性，用于指示的; 在字符串的 UTF16 编码的代码单位数和，方法，它指示实例是否为只读的。The class has only two members that provide information about the string: its property, which indicates the number of UTF16-encoded code units in the string; and the , method, which indicates whether the instance is read-only. 释放分配给内存实例Release the memory allocated to the instance 因为实现接口，通过调用释放其内存方法。Because implements the interface, you release its memory by calling the method. 类具有的检查、 比较或转换的值没有成员。The class has no members that inspect, compare, or convert the value of a . 此类成员不存在可帮助防止意外或恶意公开实例的值。The absence of such members helps protect the value of the instance from accidental or malicious exposure. 使用的适当成员类，如方法，以操作的值对象。Use appropriate members of the class, such as the method, to manipulate the value of a object. .NET Framework 类库通常使用实例在以下方面：The .NET Framework Class Library commonly uses instances in the following ways: - 通过使用提供给进程的密码信息结构，或通过调用的重载具有类型参数的方法。To provide password information to a process by using the structure or by calling an overload of the method that has a parameter of type . - 若要提供网络密码信息通过调用具有类型参数的类构造函数或使用属性。To provide network password information by calling a class constructor that has a parameter of type or by using the property. - 若要提供 SQL Server 身份验证的密码信息通过调用构造函数或检索的值属性。To provide password information for SQL Server Authentication by calling the constructor or retrieving the value of the property. - 若要将字符串传递给非托管代码。To pass a string to unmanaged code. 有关详细信息，请参阅[SecureString 和互操作](#interop)部分。For more information, see the [SecureString and interop](#interop) section. [返回页首Back to top](#top) ## SecureString 和互操作SecureString and interop 因为操作系统不直接支持，必须将转换的值对象之前将字符串传递给本机方法的必需的字符串类型。Because the operating system does not directly support , you must convert the value of the object to the required string type before passing the string to a native method. 类具有执行此操作的五种方法：The class has five methods that do this: - 转换字符串值与二进制字符串 (BSTR) 后被 com。, which converts the string value to a binary string (BSTR) recognized by COM. - 并，哪一份字符串到非托管内存中的 ANSI 字符串值。 and , which copy the string value to an ANSI string in unmanaged memory. - 并，哪一份字符串到非托管内存中的 Unicode 字符串值。 and , which copy the string value to a Unicode string in unmanaged memory. 这些方法的每个非托管内存中创建一个纯文本字符串。Each of these methods creates a clear-text string in unmanaged memory. 它负责的开发人员来清零和不再需要时，就立即释放该内存。It is the responsibility of the developer to zero out and free that memory as soon as it is no longer needed. 每个字符串转换和内存分配方法有相应的方法来清零和释放已分配的内存：Each of the string conversion and memory allocation methods has a corresponding method to zero out and free the allocated memory: |分配和转换方法Allocation and conversion method|零和 free 方法Zero and free method| |--------------------------------------|--------------------------| ||| ||| ||| ||| ||| [返回页首Back to top](#top) ## SecureString 是否安全？How secure is SecureString? 如果正确，创建实例提供更多的数据保护比。When created properly, a instance provides more data protection than a . 从字符在时间源，创建一个字符串时在内存中，会创建多个中间而创建单个实例。When creating a string from a character-at-a-time source, creates multiple intermediate in memory, whereas creates just a single instance. 垃圾回收的对象具有不确定性。Garbage collection of objects is non-deterministic. 此外，因为其内存不固定，因此垃圾回收器将制作的其他副本值时移动和压缩内存。In addition, because its memory is not pinned, the garbage collector will make additional copies of values when moving and compacting memory. 与此相反，分配给内存对象已固定，并且可以通过调用释放该内存方法。In contrast, the memory allocated to a object is pinned, and that memory can be freed by calling the method. 尽管数据存储在实例是比中存储的数据更安全实例时，有一些重要限制如何安全实例。Although data stored in a instance is more secure than data stored in a instance, there are significant limitations on how secure a instance is. 这些方法包括：These include: 平台Platform 在 Windows 操作系统的内容实例的内部字符数组进行加密。On the Windows operating system, the contents of a instance's internal character array are encrypted. 但是，由于缺少 Api 或密钥管理问题，加密不是在所有平台上。However, whether because of missing APIs or key management issues, encryption is not available on all platforms. 因为此平台依赖关系，不会加密非 Windows 平台上的内部存储。Because of this platform dependency, does not encrypt the internal storage on non-Windows platform. 在这些平台上使用的其他技术用于提供额外的保护。Other techniques are used on those platforms to provide additional protection. 持续时间Duration 即使实现能够充分利用加密，纯文本分配给实例可能会暴露在不同时间：Even if the implementation is able to take advantage of encryption, the plain text assigned to the instance may be exposed at various times: - 因为 Windows 不提供在操作系统级别的安全字符串实现，.NET Framework 仍必须将安全字符串值转换为纯文本表示形式中，若要使用它。Because Windows doesn't offer a secure string implementation at the operating system level, the .NET Framework still has to convert the secure string value to its plain text representation in order to use it. - 每当此安全字符串的值由修改方法如或，必须解密 （即，转换回为纯文本）、 修改和重新加密。Whenever the value of the secure string is modified by methods such as or , it must be decrypted (that is, converted back to plain text), modified, and then encrypted again. - 如果在互操作调用中使用的安全字符串，则它必须转换为 ANSI 字符串、 Unicode 字符串或二进制字符串 (BSTR) 中。If the secure string is used in an interop call, it must be converted to an ANSI string, a Unicode string, or a binary string (BSTR). 有关详细信息，请参阅[SecureString 和互操作](#interop)部分。For more information, see the [SecureString and interop](#interop) section. 时间间隔公开实例的值只是与缩短类。The time interval for which the instance's value is exposed is merely shortened in comparison to the class. 存储而不是使用情况Storage versus usage 一般来说，类定义的字符串值应受保护或保持机密的一种存储机制。More generally, the class defines a storage mechanism for string values that should be protected or kept confidential. 但是，在.NET Framework 本身，外部没有使用情况的机制支持。However, outside of the .NET Framework itself, no usage mechanism supports . 这意味着必须安全字符串转换为可用形式 （通常明文形式），其目标，可以识别并解密和转换必须出现在用户空间中。This means that the secure string must be converted to a usable form (typically a clear text form) that can be recognized by its target, and that decryption and conversion must occur in user space. 总体上，比更安全因为它限制了区分大小的字符串数据的透露。Overall, is more secure than because it limits the exposure of sensitive string data. 但是，这些字符串可能仍会面临的任何进程或有权访问原始内存，如主计算机、 进程转储或用户可查看交换文件上运行的恶意进程的操作。However, those strings may still be exposed to any process or operation that has access to raw memory, such as a malicious process running on the host computer, a process dump, or a user-viewable swap file. 而不是使用来保护密码，建议的替代项是使用不透明句柄存储在外部进程的凭据。Instead of using to protect passwords, the recommended alternative is to use an opaque handle to credentials that are stored outside of the process. [返回页首Back to top](#top) ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用来保护用户的密码用作凭据，以启动新进程。The following example demonstrates how to use a to secure a user's password for use as a credential to start a new process. [!code-csharp[System.Security.SecureString.Ctor#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.SecureString.Ctor/cs/ctor4.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Security.SecureString.Ctor#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.SecureString.Ctor/vb/ctor4.vb#4)]

[!code-cpp[System.Security.SecureString.Ctor#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.SecureString.Ctor/cpp/Ctor2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.SecureString.Ctor#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.SecureString.Ctor/cs/Ctor2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Security.SecureString.Ctor#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.SecureString.Ctor/vb/ctor2.vb#2)] 下面的示例创建对象的值从对象。The following example creates a object from the value of a object. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此构造函数初始化新对象中的字符数`value`指定的`length`; 然后进行加密的实例的值。This constructor initializes the new object to the number of characters in `value` specified by `length`; the value of the instance is then encrypted. 在 C# 中，仅在不安全代码的上下文中定义此构造函数。In C#, this constructor is defined only in the context of unsafe code. ## Examples 下面的示例实例化新对象通过其构造函数指针传递给字符数组。The following example instantiates a new object by passing its constructor a pointer to a character array. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果该实现使用一种保护机制，如加密、 未受保护; 如果有的话，此安全字符串的值`c`追加; 安全字符串的新值不重新保护。If the implementation uses a protection mechanism, such as encryption, the value of this secure string, if any, is unprotected; `c` is appended; then the new value of the secure string is re-protected. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何， ， ， ，并方法影响的值对象。The following example demonstrates how the , , , , and methods affect the value of a object. [!code-cpp[SecureString.xAt#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SecureString.xAt/CPP/SecureString.xAt.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SecureString.xAt#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SecureString.xAt/CS/xat.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SecureString.xAt#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/SecureString.xAt/VB/xat.vb#1)] 下面的示例演示如何和方法可用于收集密码中的字符。The following example demonstrates how the and methods can be used to collect the characters in a password. [!code-cpp[SecureString.xChar#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SecureString.xChar/CPP/SecureString.xChar.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[SecureString.xChar#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/SecureString.xChar/CS/xchar.cs#1)] [!code-vb[SecureString.xChar#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/SecureString.xChar/VB/xchar.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将写入到已分配的内存，其中包含此值的二进制零对象，然后释放已分配的内存。The method writes binary zeroes to the allocated memory that contains the value of this object, then frees the allocated memory. 有关详细信息，请参阅[垃圾回收](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/index.md)。For more information, see [Garbage Collection](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/index.md).

The character to insert.

summary.span: 在此安全字符串中的指定索引位置插入一个字符。

span.span: Inserts a character in this secure string at the specified index position.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 索引是从零开始;此安全字符串中的第一个字符的索引位置零。The index is zero-based; the first character in this secure string is at index position zero. 如果该实现使用一种保护机制，如加密、 安全字符串，如果有的值是不受保护;`c`插入到指定的索引位置; 则新值是重新保护。If the implementation uses a protection mechanism, such as encryption, the value of the secure string, if any, is unprotected; `c` is inserted at the specified index position; then the new value is re-protected. 方法生成与相同的结果方法，如果将安全字符串的末尾插入字符`index`参数的设置为此实例的长度。The method yields the same results as the method, which inserts a character at the end of a secure string, if the `index` parameter of is set to the length of this instance. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何， ， ， ，并方法影响的值对象。The following example demonstrates how the , , , , and methods affect the value of a object. MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void MakeReadOnly() cil managed

summary.span: 将此安全字符串的文本值设置为只读。

span.span: Makes the text value of this secure string read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 初始化的实例的文本值类的构造函数，并修改的值与， ， ， ，和方法。Initialize the text value of an instance of the class with the constructors, and modify the value with the , , , , and methods. 进行最终修改后，使用方法以使该实例的值不可变 （只读）。After you have made your final modifications, use the method to make the value of the instance immutable (read-only). 以只读方式标记值后，任何进一步尝试对其进行修改，则会引发。After the value is marked as read-only, any further attempt to modify it throws an . 调用的效果是永久性的因为类提供任何用于再次可修改的安全字符串。The effect of invoking is permanent because the class provides no means to make the secure string modifiable again. 使用方法来测试实例是否是只读的。Use the method to test whether an instance of is read-only. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何和方法可用于收集密码中的字符。The following example demonstrates how the and methods can be used to collect the characters in a password. 收集密码后，它由只读的。After the password is collected, it is made read-only. remarks.format: ## Remarks 索引是从零开始;在此实例中的第一个字符的索引位置零。The index is zero-based; the first character in this instance is at index position zero. 如果该实现使用一种保护机制，如加密、 未受保护; 如果有的话，此安全字符串的值移除位于指定的索引位置处的字符;新值则重新保护。If the implementation uses a protection mechanism, such as encryption, the value of this secure string, if any, is unprotected; the character at the specified index position is removed; then the new value is re-protected. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何， ， ， ，并方法影响的值对象。The following example demonstrates how the , , , , and methods affect the value of a object.
